concept.title: Disambiguation topics
concept.shortdesc: Disambiguation topics help direct readers to the appropriate content where a term or concept is ambiguous and may refer to more than one topic.

conbody.p: Disambiguation topics help clarify ambiguity when one term or topic title may relate to a number of different topics. For example, a term ABS may stand for Anti-lock Braking System or for Automatic Brightness Sequencer. A disambiguation topic is typically a single topic explaining the different uses of the term, and links to the relevant alternative topics.
